conclusion: The problem involves a detector moving along the positive x-axis with a velocity inversely proportional to its displacement.
The velocity \\( v \\) is inversely proportional to the displacement \\( x \\), expressed as \\( v = \frac{k}{x} \\).
At point B, the velocity \\( v_B = 2 \\) m/s and the displacement \\( x_B = 2 \\) m, leading to \\( k = 4 \\).
At point A, the velocity \\( v_A = 4 \\) m/s, resulting in \\( x_A = 1 \\) m.
The time \\( t \\) taken to move from point A to point B is found by integrating the reciprocal of the velocity with respect to displacement.
The integral setup is \\( t = \int_{1}^{2} \frac{x}{4} \, dx \\).
Evaluating the integral gives \\( t = \frac{1}{4} \left( 2 - 0.5 \right) = 0.375 \\) seconds.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is 0.375 seconds.
